title: Comcast Email Settings
content:
I have been trying to get my Comcast email configured for days with no luck. When I try to log in using my Comcast password I get a screen that shows "Access Denied You don't have permission to access "http://login.xfinity.com/login" on this server. Reference #18.321c2e17.1727662977.283cff2b https://errors.edgesuite.net/18.321c2e17.1727662977.283cff2b. I have allowed access to third party apps on my Comcast account and I am able to access my email on the Comcast website with no problem. I saw something about disabling IPV6 but it said to go to Preferences or Options in the Settings menu. My version of Thunderbird (latest) doesn't have these menu options. I have tried various IMAP and SMTP Port settings I found on the internet and nothing works.

What are the settings for Comcast email in Thunderbird?

I think what caused the problem this time -- and possibly last time too -- is clicking on a link in a particular message from a specific sender, linking to a document found inside a password-protected portal. title: Removed CALdav addon, then no google birthdays
content:
128.2.3esr 64bit on Ubuntu Linux (24.04)

I had the provider plugin for google calendar and lightning working for years now.

But then some appointments could not be closed. So I did the search on this site and the solution was to remove the add-on and use the internal calendar function.

I did that and connected with my google account to have my calendar events back. But that left out all my contacts birthdays.

Search brought something up about installing a plugin for the birthdays, but since I had to remove a plugin to have things working nearly as they should, I did not go the road to install a plugin after removing one.

Installed plugins now: Mail Merge No Message Pane Sort

Thanks in advance for trying to help!

title: Thunderbird windows too big for screen
content:
I was trying to help a friend set up her Gmail account in Thunderbird and after putting in all the settings, a window popped up asking me to allow Thunderbird to access Gmail, but the button to select allow was at the bottom of the window, below the bottom of my screen, and there was no way to scroll all the way down. I also was unable to make the window smaller. So I was unable to set up the account.

I figured this was a problem caused by Google, because I had set up an account with another provider (Sonic) without trouble. But when I tried to work with the address book for that account, I ran into problems with the Thunderbird window being too wide for the screen, and it was very difficult to access buttons there too. I had to move the entire window sideways off the screen, and extend the window even further to find the edit button. I never did find a save button that I assume is on the bottom of that window.

On my own system I still use a very old version of Thunderbird, and never run into such problems, but this newest version that I downloaded a few days ago looks and functions quite different. Also my friend is on a Mac, and my own system is a PC, so perhaps the Mac version functions differently than the one for PC?

I would appreciate any insight to adjust the windows to a workable size on the screen, and to set up my friend's Gmail account.

Thanks so much.

title: Strange duplicate folders appearing spontaneously in Local Folders
content:
Spontaneous appearance of new folders among Local Folders:

Another Thunderbird user, a member of our computer club, has experienced a strange event in his TB folder structure. He regularly saves incoming emails to his Local Folders (from one or other of two IMAP accounts). Recently he has found that new folders have appeared spontaneously among his Local Folders, usually bearing the name of an existing folder with name suffixed with "- 1" then "- 2", as in "<oldname> - 1". One folder seemed to be a copy of an old folder including most of its contents; others have had only one, or no contents.

Host OS is Windows 10. Our member has Version 128 of TB with automatic updating. We have replaced his Profile (by renaming the old Profile) but the problem has returned. At the return one of the new folders has a name of this form: "<Personal name of friend>.msf.compact - backup".

Has anyone else seen this behaviour? What might be the cause? Do we need to uninstall and reinstall Thunderbird to cure this sickness?

(Our computer club is Melbourne PC User Group, Australia.)
creator: halewis1

title: Thunderbird:  Moved Folders and now most of the conents are missing
content:
In a foolish attempt to quickly reorganize, I moved a VITAL folder from Local Folders to a n EMail Account folder. I have done this a couple of times before over the years without problems but never with this large of a folder. Foolishly, I trusted the process and DID NOT DO A BACKUP first. (You would think I would have learned after 40+ years not to trust past experience, only Backups.)

After the move, the original folder remains but is empty and the new folder contains less than 95% of the original contents. Is there ANY recover process available? The old Thunderbird used to just tag deleted and moved contents until you compacted the data so you could manually recover.

Does such an option exist?

Any ideas or suggestions would be GREATLY appreciate as this is a folder containing communications associated with a Non-Profit for which I am the Chair. Client mode is off-line and all mail is downloaded from the Server at each check so the Mail Server is not an option.

Thanks in advance for any morsels of wisdom... Besides BACKUP!
creator: SteveMeyerSr

title: non ricevo email da gmail sul PC
content:
buongiorno , cortesemente ho un problema che mi assilla da tempo e chiedo aiuto :

Non ricevo sul pc le mail inviate dai cellulari ovviamente con dominio gmail...

Ho due account sulla finestra di Thunder uno associato ad @alice.it e l'altro a @gmail.com che funzionano perfettamente per tutti gli scopi , MA purtroppo su @alice.it tutte le mail inviatomi (da un qualsiasi cellulare) con estensione GMAIL non mi arriva MAI .... Nessuna segnalazione sul mio pc e nessuna segnalazione di errore a chi lo invia quindi per me buio nero mentre per chi l'ha inviata risulta processata correttamente . Non ho trovato nulla in rete riguardo il mio problema perche si parla molto come sincronizzare gmail con thunder oppure di aggiungere account ma questi non sono i miei problemi perche le mie mail funzionano correttamente. Ho controllato " gestisci i filtri per i messaggi" non trovando nessun mittente bloccato, ho fatto la ricerca per nome  : "gmail " - " @gmail " - " @gmail.com " .... risultato ? il nulla. Certo che la lista di nomi bloccati inserendo solo " com " oppure " .com" è piuttosto lunga , man nulla a che fare con il miko problema.

" versione thunder 115.15.0 (64bit) "

Non ho molta pratica nella configurazione mail quindi chiedo il vostro aiuto . grazie in anticipo Mauro Zafferini
creator: zaff.m

title: Thunderbird apparently losing email occasionally (pop3)
content: This is the second time this has happened. I clicked the Get Messages button in Thunderbird and it said there were no messages - I knew there had to be some. So I shut down Thunderbird and restarted it. Again tried Get Messages. This time a notification popped up saying something about not being able to access the inbox because it was being used by something else. I clicked OK in that notification and then it immediately started downloading messages, counting up to 27 - everything looked normal. However, nothing appeared in the inbox. Unfortunately, I had the pop3 setup to delete messages from the server once downloaded (I have since changed that), so when I checked the server, there was nothing there. So it appears that everything worked as expected except that the messages did not appear in the inbox. I checked other folders and do not see them. Where could they have gone? And more importantly, is there any chance I can get them? Regards, Dave
creator: dgheyl

From the message subject and header, some of these messages are important to me. How can I force TB to display them like it does the other messages. NOTE: Nothing in the message header indicates the messages with this problem are any different from the messages that are properly displayed.

title: How to force persistent message pane
content:
Hello, I run a vertical four pane layout (accounts, inbox, message pane, events). Everything is working perfectly except my message pane seems to hide randomly. I think I have narrowed the problem to the message pane min-width cutoff.

If I reduce the size of the message pane it suddenly collapses into a vertical orange bar. I noticed I can reverse drag this vanishing orange bar to restore the message pane. However, I can only grab this orange bar if the "events pane" is hidden.

I know I can just hit a hotkey (which I have masked to a system global hotkey) or go to the menu view>layout>message pane, but after doing this about 50 times I was wondering if there is some setting to disable this behavior entirely. I suspect this behavior is due to the many negative feedback about the message pane I found in my searches, but I want to say that I really like and need the message pane.

title: Unable to import contacts from vCard file.
content: I am currently trying out Thunderbird 128.2.3esr (64-bit) on windows 10 home version 22H2. I have been using Mailbird. When I try to "Address Book" "Import" "vCard File" the import completes successfully. But when I look at the list of contacts only several show names. The rest are blank and when I click on the blank contacts in the list the right hand pane is also empty of values. I tried multiple times with different .vcf files with the same result. So I broke the .vcf files apart thinking that it could only handle so many at a time. Nope! some of the .vcf files import. Most import and create a blank contact. Each of the vCard files has a possibly different set of fields and I can not see a pattern in the ones that are accepted compared to the ones that are not. Help please. p.s. I have the plain vanilla Thunderbird with no extensions.

title: Email in Drafts folder is Sent without my clicking SEND. No record of the sending exists in the SENT folder
content: Today is the first day using your latest update of Thunderbird (128.2.3esr (64-bit)) and I have been experiencing problems. In certain conditions when I am either editing a new email or receiving email, an email in my Drafts folder is Sent without my clicking SEND. No record of the sending exists in the SENT folder but the intended recipient has received it. In a second problem, the Correspondent in a mailbox has been edited to that ALL the email in the mailbox shows that Correspondent being the sender. I claim you have bugs in this release.
creator: af8c

title: Asian characters in the "To" and "From" headers when using one of my email addresses
content:
One of my email addresses, info@guninstructor.com, is used to communicate to and from students on my website. Suddenly, the registration forms received now have Asian characters instead of English in the "To" and "From" header spaces. If I print out the registration form, the Asian characters change to English. If I try a test email from one of my other email addresses to the info address, when I enter the info address in the "To" space, the memory automatically changes the address to the Asian characters for the name but not for the actual email address. My saved registration form emails dating all the way back to 2018 were also changed to the Asian character "To" and "From" header spaces. These were all previously English.

Is this some type of malware? Is it in my Firefox/Thunderbird program or is it in my website programming? My website is Word Press and is current and maintained.

Thank you in advance for your time and effort. This is mystifying to me.
creator: cewens1

title: Email codificado
content: Estou tendo problemas em um cliente com emails que chegam todo criptografados e não abre as mensagens, já fiz a reinstalação, sincronização e nada de resolver, alguem tem ideia do que pode ser?
creator: gabrielrubensdeps

title: Thunderbird
content: I just downloaded Thunderbird to gain access to my existing Outlook and Apple email accounts. However, Thunderbird does not work with Mac 10.13.6 OS. Do you have any suggestions to implement the "Modern Authentication Methods" with my older 10.13.6 OS? Any help would be appreciated. Thanks
creator: THasemeier

title: Thunderbird'de hotmail postalarını alamıyorum
content:
Merhaba, daha önce hotmail postalarını sorunsuz alıyordum fakat hiç bir ayar değişikliği yapmamama rağmen hotmail postalarını alamıyorum. Kendime test maili gönderince de;

"İletinin gönderilmesi başarısız oldu. 

giden sunucusu (SMTP) ile bağlantı başarısız olduğu için ileti gönderilemedi. Sunucu hizmet dışı olabilir veya SMTP bağlantılarını geri çeviriyor olabilir. Giden sunucusu (SMTP) ayarlarınızın doğruluğunu kontrol edip yeniden deneyin." mesajı verdi.

Yeni mailleri almak isteyince de "pop3.live.com sunucusuna s..........@hotmail.com kullanıcı adıyla giriş başarısız oldu." mesajı veriyor. Şifre giriyorum ama yine olmuyor.

Başka bir kullanıcıya verilen yardımda şu vardı, bunu da denedim ama yine olmadı; Menü > Ayarlar > Genel sayfasında en alta gidip Yapılandırma düzenleyici'ye tıklayın. mail.server.default.check_all_folders_for_new tercihini bulup true olarak değiştirin.

Çözüm için fikri olan var mı acaba?
creator: sinancapan

title: Thunderbird eMail
content: When hovering over a link in a message, my cursor auyomatically goes into enlarge mode (+) and prevents me from opening the link
creator: laister

title: Zimbra and Thunderbird label matching
content:
Hello We use Thunderbird for our emails with a zimbra provider,

The problem is that when we're away and teleworking, our teams use webmail and thunderbird's tags don't really go back up to the zimbra server. 

(they're displayed but we can't manage them: they don't appear in zimbra's tags/labels menu)

and conversely, zimbra's tags don't go back down to thunderbird at all. 

This is very annoying because we have a group mailbox where the tags are used to divide up the work and when we're away in webmail mode, it's impossible to find our mail.

does anyone have a clue? 

we've already customized the pref.js file to tune the tags between each machine, so i'm thinking there must be a command in "pref.js" that lets you create tags recognized by the server and vice versa. 
thanks for your insight

PS: we can compensate the solution.
creator: lmd5

title: Migrate address book from Tbird v52 to v78 - format conversion needed?
content:
I want to migrate from Thunderbird 52.9.1 on an old Win7 PC to a fresh install of Thunderbird 78.13 on a new Win10 PC. Both PCs are 64-bit. I use POP, not IMAP.

Because Tbird v52 on Win7 was incrementally upgraded from Tbird v2 through the years I would prefer to start with a fresh Tbird 78.13 on Win10 and then migrate over the mail and address book from v52 on Win7 to v78 on Win10. After I have completed migrating to v78.13 on the Win 10 PC and all appears to be working well I will proceed with upgrades to a more current version.

The migration process seems fairly straightforward except that I am aware the format for the address book changed with v78(?).

Do I need to do anything 'special' to migrate the address book from v52 into v78 and have it function properly?

Will an export from v52 and then an import into v78 perform whatever format conversions are necessary for the address book to work on v78?

Will a straight copy of the v52 address book file pasted into v78 work properly?

Or is there something else I need to do?

Thanks!
creator: opti1

title: Trying to print an email causes hard loop
content:
I am using Thunderbird 115.15.0 (64-bit) on openSUSE Thundebird. This is the KDE version. I have verified that it fails with both the Wayland and X11 versions.

Why I try to print an email, the Print Dialog appears with the circular animation and the message "Preparing Preview." It then hangs in a loop. The only way to stop it is to use the System Monitor to Kill Thunderbird.

This is a serious problem as there are emails that need to be printed and there is no convenient way to print them otherwise.
creator: johnrcox

creator: mental-tarsus02

title: Dragging folder to another folder immediately opens destination folder with no hover time. Extremely annoying!
content:
Dragging folder to another folder immediately opens destination folder. How do I stop that? Problem did not exist in version 102.15.1. When having to move multiple folders it is extremely annoying to have the destination folder open instantly every time.

(My destination folder has many subfolders so having it open without my permission causes me to lose my place and have to scroll to close the destination folder every time.
creator: SadFirefoxUser

title: Attachment size GROWS
content: I attached a file which TB correctly showed to be 23.3MB in size. (FileLink's not an option.) But when I clicked on Send, it asked me if I'm sure I want to send an attachment of file size 31.9MB! The initial size would have gone through. Gmail would not accept the latter size. How did the size grow by nearly 8MB?!
creator: doniel

title: TB 128.2.3esr displays only last email, has many in folder
content:
I see my particular problem has been ongoing, but it's the first time for me.

After latest update, 128.2.3esr, I can only see and access one email, the last one that arrived to the folder. None of the fixes I read about have worked for me. Once I watched as several emails arrived, they appeared one by one, then disappeared to make way for the next.

Can you suggest anything? Following one list of instructions, I made a link to a pastebin page. https://pastebin.mozilla.org/VQJJM8Md In Troubleshooting mode, TB looks more or less as I expect. That is, I can access all emails. There was another question to answer, but I lost the conversation while rummaging around.

Should I continue to work on this, or wait for the next update? In the meantime, I am emailing from my Earthlink page, but I really prefer TB's flexibility.

Thanks for any suggestions.
creator: gbpos
